node_detail_info.title: EU pushes back against claims Russian oil ban is hiking prices
node_detail_info.lines: In a bid to prevent further market disruption, the United States is leading the cause to introduce a price cap on Russian oil. The idea was born out of the last G7 meeting but Washington is keen to bring the entire G20 on board to secure a larger and stronger majority.   "A price cap on Russian oil is one of our most powerful tools to address the pain that Americans and families across the world are feeling at the gas pump and the grocery store right now," saidJanet Yellen,US Secretary of the Treasury.

related_infos.title: Ukraine grain ship clears inspection in Turkey
related_infos.lines: Ukrainian officials said another 17 vessels were "loaded and waiting for permission to leave" under a July 22 deal brokered by the United Nations and Turkey to let shipments resume distributing the20 million tons of grain that have been stuck in the country, causing global food shortages.   Ukraine is a major grain exporter, but a Russian blockade in the Black Sea has prevented it from safely continuing shipments. Lingering anger and mistrust between Kyiv and Moscow has threatened to derail the agreement, which lasts four months but can be extended.

children.name: An Army Alone Doesnt Make You a Great Power
tree_titlename: An Army Alone Doesnt Make You a Great Power
tree_filePath: ../../preprocess/news_crawling/RUS_UKR/p_articles/msn.com/An Army Alone Doesnt Make You a Great Power.txt

node_detail_info.title: An Army Alone Doesnt Make You a Great Power
node_detail_info.lines: New College student pushes back against DeSantis: 'they can't change the culture of this school'   Indeed, looking at the question from both historical and contemporary perspectives, it actually makes more sense to approach the issue from the opposite end: to question what generates military power, the answer to which will then help us understand the difference between true great powers and false ones. Militaries are manifestations of the underlying factors that create them, and these factors have far more impact on how militaries function in war than numerical tables of how much equipment they hold or how many soldiers they have. To understand how a genuine great power is built, we should explore a countrys characteristics in three distinct categories: the foundational, the shaping, and the product.
